snippet: Radovan Karadzic, the Bosnian Serb wartime leader, told judges at the United Nations War Crimes Tribunal on Tuesday that he should be “rewarded for all the good things I have done.”
abstract: Bosnian Serb wartime leader Radovan Karadzic, once known for his virulent speeches,   tells international judges in new phase of his genocide trial that he is a 'mild' and 'tolerant' man and that he did everything in his power to stop the war in Bosnia.
lead_paragraph: Radovan Karadzic, the Bosnian Serb wartime leader, told judges at the United Nations War Crimes Tribunal on Tuesday that he should be “rewarded for all the good things I have done.”

headline.seo: Radovan Karadzic Begins Genocide Defense at Hague
headline.main: Former Bosnian Leader Begins His Defense at Genocide Trial
headline.print_headline: Bosnian Serb Defiantly Begins His Defense at Genocide Trial

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
